page.title: 06HIGH AND LOW PENNYVENIE-1
page.content:
High and Low Pennyvenie were two of the rows of terraced cottages built by the mining company to house their employees. These rows stretched at intervals for about two kilometres up the Cummock Valley. There were many similar settlements elsewhere in the Ayrshire coalfield. Today of all the houses only the row at Sighthill is still tenanted.
When we visited Pennyvenie Farm Mr Ireland told us some of his memories of the mining village which lay near his farm.
The villagers had a community hall where dances and other social activities were held. In summer there was a Gala when a variety of festivities took place including races and sometimes a band concert.
